title: Speech Therapy
shortDescription: Addresses communication challenges including speech, language, and social communication.
description: Speech-language therapy helps children with autism develop communication skills, including verbal speech, language comprehension, and social communication. Speech-language pathologists (SLPs) assess each child's unique communication profile and create individualized treatment plans. Therapy may focus on articulation, vocabulary, sentence structure, conversational skills, pragmatic language, and alternative communication methods for non-verbal children.
benefits: Improves verbal communication and speech clarity
Introduces alternative communication systems when needed
